text: In The Immortalists, Chloe Benjamin follows the lives of four siblings who learn the dates of their deaths from a fortune teller when they are children. The novel explores how this knowledge shapes their lives, influencing their decisions, relationships, and aspirations. As each sibling approaches the time of their predicted death, they reflect on how their past actions have been affected by the knowledge of their future. Benjamin illustrates the tension between fate and free will, suggesting that while we cannot control the events of our lives, our awareness of the future can still profoundly shape our present. This suggests that ______.
question: Which choice most logically completes the text?
A: knowing the time of our death completely determines the course of our lives, removing any possibility of free will.
B: knowing our fate allows us to make better decisions, eliminating regrets and uncertainties about life.
C: our awareness of the future can influence our decisions and actions, even though we cannot control what is to come.
D: the knowledge of our death has no impact on how we live our lives, as fate is unavoidable regardless of our choices.
explanation:
Choice B is the best answer. The text suggests that while knowledge of the future does not control our lives, it has a profound influence on our decisions and actions, supporting this conclusion.Choice A is incorrect. The novel explores the tension between fate and free will, and suggests that while the knowledge of death impacts the characters, it doesn’t entirely determine their lives.Choice C is incorrect. While the characters reflect on their actions, the novel suggests that knowledge of death doesn’t eliminate regrets or uncertainties, but rather complicates their decisions.Choice D is incorrect. The novel indicates that knowledge of death significantly influences how the characters live, making this choice misleading.
